name: linkedin-jobs-scraper
title: LinkedIn Jobs Scraper - Advanced Edition
description: Production-ready actor for scraping comprehensive job listings from LinkedIn including detailed job information and hiring team/recruiter details. Features anti-detection measures, residential proxy support, and hiring manager extraction.

searchQueries.title: Search Queries
searchQueries.description: Array of job titles, keywords, or skills to search for (e.g., ['Software Engineer', 'Data Scientist'])

location.title: Location
location.description: Geographic location for job search. Use country name or city name (e.g., 'United States', 'United Kingdom', 'San Francisco')

maxResults.title: Maximum Results
maxResults.description: Maximum number of job listings to scrape. Helps control scraping scope and cost.

maxConcurrency.title: Max Concurrency
maxConcurrency.description: Maximum number of concurrent requests. LinkedIn requires LOW concurrency (1-2 recommended). Higher values may result in IP blocking.

minDelayBetweenRequests.title: Min Delay Between Requests (ms)
minDelayBetweenRequests.description: Minimum delay in milliseconds between requests to avoid detection. Simulates human behavior.

maxDelayBetweenRequests.title: Max Delay Between Requests (ms)
maxDelayBetweenRequests.description: Maximum delay in milliseconds between requests.

proxyConfiguration.title: Proxy Configuration
proxyConfiguration.description: Proxy settings for the scraper. Set useApifyProxy to true to use Apify's proxy service, or provide custom proxy URLs.

useApifyProxy.title: Use Apify Proxy
useApifyProxy.description: Use Apify's proxy service. Recommended: use residential proxies for LinkedIn.

linkedinCookies.title: LinkedIn Session Cookies (Optional)
linkedinCookies.description: JSON-formatted LinkedIn session cookies for authenticated scraping. Improves success rate and access to more job details. Format: JSON string of cookie array.

customData.title: Custom Data
customData.description: Custom metadata to include with each scraped job record (e.g., campaign ID, purpose of scraping)

extendOutputFunction.title: Extend Output Function
extendOutputFunction.description: Custom JavaScript function to extend and transform job output data. Function receives (job, page, request) and must return modified job object.
extendOutputFunction.example: async (job, page, request) => { job.scraperVersion = '2.0.0'; return job; }

debugMode.title: Debug Mode
debugMode.description: Enable detailed logging for debugging and monitoring.

output.title: LinkedIn Job Listing Output
output.description: Detailed job listing information including hiring team details

url.description: Direct URL to the LinkedIn job posting

company.description: Company name hiring for this position

locationType.description: Type of work location (On-site, Remote, Hybrid)

seniority.description: Seniority level required (Entry-level, Mid-level, Senior, Executive)

jobCriteria.description: List of job criteria/requirements extracted from the listing

postedDate.description: When the job was posted (e.g., '2 weeks ago')

hiringTeam.description: List of hiring team members/recruiters with their details

name.description: Name of the recruiter or hiring manager

profileUrl.description: LinkedIn profile URL of the recruiter

searchQuery.description: The search query used to find this job

location_filter.description: The location filter used in the search

scrapedAt.description: ISO timestamp when the job was scraped

documentation: For detailed documentation and usage examples, see README.md
